name: sfchronicle
text:
Why the anger over #GeorgeFloyd’s killing is so much more intense.

Story by @KevinChron: https://t.co/YafUkKeoFH

name: sfchronicle
text:
George Floyd protest updates: SFPD begin lining up against boarded-up buildings early Sunday evening on Market Street near the Powell cable car turnaround and at the Westfield Center in an apparent attempt to discourage destructive protests and looting.

https://t.co/L5kcXBXMZD

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: BART tweeted that the Bay Fair station in San Leandro was closed due to a “civil disturbance.”

https://t.co/94qzo0tLNp https://t.co/TeERqR1Mt9

name: sfchronicle
text:
More than a thousand people walk down San Francisco's Market Street, chanting “No justice! No Peace!” 

Reporter @TrishaThadani describes the scene as energetic and peaceful.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/qTxe0aksTC

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @lizziejohnsonnn: A peaceful march down San Francisco’s Market Street (about two hours before curfew). Motorists on Third Street are honking in support. Hundreds of police officers line either side of the street, along with Sheriff’s deputies from as far as Mariposa. https://t.co/AWhs8s8F98A peaceful march down San Francisco’s Market Street (about two hours before curfew). Motorists on Third Street are… https://t.co/tOyVCWizLe

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @lizziejohnsonnn: The march is loud with drumbeats and chanting. The police follow close behind, passerbyers heckling them as they go. Every time they stop, officers at the end of the line stand back to back. https://t.co/mwLw2V7UegThe march is loud with drumbeats and chanting. The police follow close behind, passerbyers heckling them as they go… https://t.co/VxBP3Cgg8Y

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @lizziejohnsonnn: Have been noticing new graffiti around #SanFrancisco: https://t.co/C4sECtPx1D

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @lizziejohnsonnn: Paired up with @TrishaThadani tonight to cover San Francisco and its curfew — and anything else that might happen. Follow us and the @sfchronicle for more information.Paired up with @TrishaThadani tonight to cover San Francisco and its curfew — and anything else that might happen.… https://t.co/qeJidRh9O7

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: BART closes several stations due to civil disturbances including Civic Center and Walnut Creek. https://t.co/jSf41KVFOC

name: sfchronicle
text: LATEST: A San Jose Police officer has been taken off street duty after a video of him cursing at protesters went viral on social media, San Jose Mayor Sam Liccardo said in a Sunday news conference. https://t.co/HuDXiVvgQ0

name: sfchronicle
text: LIVE UPDATES: A crowd of about 50 people, many dressed in black and carrying backpacks, were trying to break into Best Buy in Pleasant Hill. No police were visible. https://t.co/nrXjXq8ppZ

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: Walnut Creek issues 6:00 p.m. curfew for today and asks all businesses downtown to close immediately due to civil unrest. https://t.co/vhcAoYSV2V

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @TrishaThadani: About 1,000 ppl here at SF City Hall. Speaker yelling through a megaphone: “This is family. This is the family that is going to bring the revolution.” https://t.co/G3ybNDW8PnAbout 1,000 ppl here at SF City Hall. Speaker yelling through a megaphone: “This is family. This is the family that… https://t.co/zypMH4Q9ja

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @lizziejohnsonnn: About 1,000 people gathered outside of San Francisco City Hall. Speakers with blow horns said that this was a “revolution” and that we “are living right now.” Everyone quietly rose their fists in solidarity. 

A woman lit palo santo to cleanse the air: “We need that right now.” https://t.co/gQbAoM2jWsAbout 1,000 people gathered outside of San Francisco City Hall. Speakers with blow horns said that this was a “revo… https://t.co/IPSP0Q72zy

name: sfchronicle
text:
”Fist up, Fight back”: In Sacramento, protesters chant as they prepare to march.

The demonstration is peaceful and there is heavy CHP presence, reports @DustinGardiner.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/2XvbumZuOv

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here's what's happening in the East Bay:

Walnut Creek
 - 6 p.m. curfew issued for Sunday
 - Businesses asked to shut down immediately

Pleasant Hill
 - People warned to stay away from city’s downtown
 - Reports of crowd outside Best Buy

https://t.co/owKP4ZLAPh
